source.name: Final Critical Habitat for the Helotes mold beetle (Batrisodes venyivi)
source.description: Abstract: To provide the user with a general idea of areas where final critical habitat for Helotes mold beetle (Batrisodes venyivi) based on the description provided in the Federal Register. The geographic extent includes Bexar County, TX. This is one of seven invertebrate species addressed in the April 8, 2003 Federal Register document entitled: Endangered and Threatened Wildlife and Plants; Designation of Critical Habitat for Seven Bexar County, TX, Invertebrate Species; Final Rule (68 FR 17155 17231).     Purpose: Critical habitat are areas considered essential for the conservation of a listed species. These areas provide notice to the public and land managers the importance of these areas to the conservation of this species. Special protections and/or restrictions are possible in areas where federal funding, permits, licenses, authorizations, or actions occur or are required.
